content: Huawei HUANGSearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationShort Bio, CV, and LinksHuawei Huang is a Professor at Sun Yat-sen University, and a dual-appointment professor at the Hong Kong Advanced Research Institute of SYSU and at Lingnan College of SYSU. Since 2023, he has been consecutively recognized among the Top 2% Scientists Worldwide by Stanford University. He is an IEEE Senior Member and a Senior Member of the China Computer Federation (CCF). His research interests span high-performance blockchain systems and protocols, blockchain finance, DeFi protocols, and Web3 infrastructures. He has published numerous research findings in top journals and conferences such as IEEE/ACM ToN, JSAC, TPDS, TSC, TDSC, TIFS, TMC, TC, and INFOCOM. He has chaired many academic conferences, workshops, and symposiums. He is the author of three blockchain monographs, as well as a popular science book on blockchain entitled “From Blockchain to Web3: building the next-generation Internet.” Under his leadership, his team developed and open-sourced a blockchain experimental tool named BlockEmulator, which provides researchers with a mature, high-quality experimental framework and code. Prof. Huawei Huang's research group has initialized BrokerChain, a high-performance Layer1 blockchain, which provides a research and development platform for both academia and industry, supporting blockchain innovations, DeFi protocol development, and Real-World Assets (RWA) tokenization, etc.My CV  (updated on  May 7, 2025)Email:  huanghw28[at]sysu.edu.cn ( [at] -> @ )Lab Page: http://www.xintelligence.pro https://orcid.org/0000-0002-7035-6446[Google Scholar][ResearchGate][blockEmulator]News:July 2025: The testnet of BrokerChain (a Layer1 sharding blockchain) is online! Visit its Github page here: github.com/HuangLab-SYSU/brokerchain-academic BrokerChain (academic) Testnet is EVM-compatible. Students and researchers can develop/deploy smart contracts on this testnet much cheaper than on Ethereum.BrokerChain's Dashboard (public data provided) is here: academic.broker-chain.com:56741/ This dashboard provides public data, including token minting, the number of blockchain shards, active miner nodes, the waiting list of nodes, and the faucet for developers.
